identity.name: Cognitive Library
identity.description: A knowledge assistant that feels like a high-end research library, not a chatbot. It prioritizes reading experience, citation clarity, and intellectual focus.

button.default: rounded-none font-medium tracking-wide uppercase text-xs px-6 py-3 transition-all duration-200 active:scale-95

instructions_to_main_agent: Implement the 'Cognitive Library' theme: Think strict grids, serif headings, and generous whitespace.
Use the color palette strictly. Primary color #C2410C is for CTAs only.
Sidebar should be Dark (#121212) to create a focus tunnel for the main content.
Typography: Use Libre Baskerville for all H1-H3. Use Manrope for Body.
Component Shapes: Avoid rounded-lg or rounded-xl. Stick to rounded-none or rounded-sm (2px) for a professional, document-like feel.
Chat Interface: Make it look like a dialogue script, not an iMessage chat.
Citations: Display them as footnotes or distinct side-notes, not inline links.
universal_guidelines: Dark colors look good when used independently without gradients. DO NOT use dark colors as gradients
Don't make generic centered layouts, simplistic gradients, and uniform styling.
Create depth through layered design elements with z-index hierarchy
Use glass-morphism effects with backdrop filters (12-24px blur) for floating elements only
You MUST NOT apply universal transition. Eg: transition: all. This results in breaking transforms. Always add transitions for specific interactive elements like button, input excluding transforms
You MUST NOT center align the app container, ie do not add .App { text-align: center; } in the css file. This disrupts the human natural reading flow of text
Always use modern button styles like pill-shaped, or sharp button with interaction animations & color relevant to the app style
NEVER: use AI assistant Emoji characters like ðŸ¤–ðŸ§  for icons.
Every interaction needs micro-animations - hover states, transitions. Static = dead.
Use 2-3x more spacing than feels comfortable.
Subtle grain textures, noise overlays, custom cursors, selection states, and loading animations: separates good from extraordinary.
